p:
Testing was performed with the as-prepared electrocatalysts loaded on the gas diffusion layer of the air electrode of an in-house-made ZAB at room temperature. The catalyst ink was prepared as described above and drop-cast onto carbon paper at a mass loading of 1 mg cm −2. The air cathode was coated with a 1:1 (w/w) mixture of 20 wt % Pt/C and 5 wt % Ru/C at the same total catalyst loading. Zn foil was used as the metal anode, and a solution containing 6 M KOH (Guaranteed Reagent, Junsei Co., Ltd.) and 0.2 M zinc acetate (Sigma-Aldrich Co., Ltd.) was used as the electrolyte. Polarization curves were constructed by performing LSV measurements at a sweep rate of 10 mV s −1 using an electrochemical workstation (Biologic, VSP, France). Specific capacity and energy density were calculated as [ 47]
4

5
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$${\text{Specific}}\,{\text{capacity}}\,({\text{mA}}\,{\text{h}}\,{\text{g}}^{ - 1} ) = I\Delta t/\omega_{\text{Zn}}$$\end{document}
Specific
capacity
( mA
h
g
- 1
)
= I Δ t /
ω Zn
where I, V, Δ t, and ω Zn represent the current, average discharge voltage, testing time, and amount of consumed Zn, respectively.
